Our favorite Black Mesa security guard (read unique Barney clone) goes on a adventure in order to escape Black Mesa.

Bem curtinho, mas um bom complemento ao jogo original, um bom tempo de divers√£o adicionado se vc gostou de jogar o primeiro, interessante ver o ponto de vista do guardinha que lhe d√° uma ajuda na miss√£o do original.

lemme preface, when i say i recommend the game, i exclusively mean to those who want more half-life 1 style content. this is a very skippable entry however.

let's start with the pros: it's an expansion of half-life 1, a game i found so enjoyable, so the mechanics being mostly the same definitely made me enjoy it more. plus, the continuity between this game and the base game are fun to see. unfortunately, i did have more negatives with this game than i did the original.

the game took me 3 hours to finish and probably could've taken less if i hadn't made myself dinner midway through the game, leaving it idle on my pc. it's so short that you dont really get the chance to appreciate anything until the credits roll. this doesnt make the game bad, per se, but compared to the 15 hours i took in base half life, it was extremely underwhelming

adding onto that aspect, the last couple chapters felt very much like a chore. [spoiler]xen felt better than in half-life 1, but the last 2 chapters where you're trying to get the charged battery just felt very tedious and not as fun as the rest of the game.[/spoiler] it kind of felt like padding, as if they needed to reach some sort of playtime quota. a short game, especially as an expansion pack, can still be really fun, but feeling the need to expand this by 2 whole chapters that really didn't need to exist just made the game feel so much more arduous to complete.

the weapons were also very lackluster. [spoiler]since you arent playing as gordon, but rather as "b. calhoun" who is a security guard, thus only really having access to a pistol for a good portion of the game. you do get the shotgun, smg, and some explosives later on, but the experimental and alien weapons were inaccessible (except for the snarks, which i never use). i know that's for lore and continuity purposes, but it was still upsetting to only have some pretty basic weaponry.[/spoiler]

overall, yes i do recommend it, as it was very fun, but i would not classify it as a must-play if you are trying to get into half-life. there isnt much lore present here that wasnt already known from the first game and as such, it's very skippable. if all you care about is seeing the events of the black mesa incident from the point of view of that security guard you see on your tram ride, then this serves exactly that purpose. 6/10

I know I haven't played much but hear me out.
This game is pretty good, a nice addition to the Half-Life series, but it's probably my least favorite game in the franchise and here's 3 reasons why:

1. The HD models; They just don't look that good. But I do think they fit better into the context of Blue Shift than they do in Half-Life, which makes them slightly tolerable here. 

2, The story isn't that great. I haven't played for much longer and the story is really basic. It's just Half-Life 1 from Barnie's perspective, I know Half-Life: Opposing Force is just HL1 from a HECU soldier's perspective, but the thing that made that game so good was the new content, the new enemies, weapons, and environments just make it way better than this.

3. This game just feels like extra levels for the base game of Half-Life. I know Opposing Force is also "technically" just extra levels, the reasons I listed above show why Opposing Force is just a better game.

Now, just because there's some things I don't like about it, doesn't mean you shouldn't buy this game. Its a pretty good game if you've beaten Half-Life 1 and want something else to play. ]

It's the weakest of the Half Life games, but it's ok.

Im very torn on this game, the puzzles are better than the first one, the pacing is better, the environments are better, there is only ONE Xen level and its really short. But it still suffers from the first ones bad gunplay although it is much better in this game because there are much less bullet sponge enemies and usually when there are those types of enemies you actually have ammo. The biggest problem with the game however is the CONSTANT stuttering and freezing which is especially bad in the latter half of the game, I even crashed twice at the very end of the game. I think its much better than the first which I know is EXTREMELY controversial but I really appreciated the level design of this game which was even better than the first because a lot of the fluff is able to be cut out with smaller levels. Overall though, I think the constant freezing and crashing ruined the game for me, I could have seen myself replaying it but frankly I dont want to even try because like the first it happens way to often.

compared to Half-Life 1 and Opposing Force, Blue Shift is pretty short. I don't know if that's because it was originally gonna be in the Dreamcast version of Half-Life before it got cancelled, Besides that, it's overall not a bad game. there's something so real about just being a security guard trying to make it out of the facility. Short but sweet
